DataElement.preferredName: Clavien-Dindo Classification of Surgical Complications Sensory Nerve Damage Present Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A scale that represents the Clavien-Dindo Classification of surgical complications related to sensory nerve damage.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clavien-Dindo Classification Sensory Nerve Damage Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A classification of adverse events that grades complications according to the treatment that is induced to treat the complication. The classification is designed to eliminate subjective interpretation of serious adverse events and tendency to down-rate complications, being based on data that is usually well documented and easy to verify. It is also well suited for retrospective analyses.:Having to do with the senses._Injury to nervous tissue._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A classification of adverse events that grades complications according to the treatment that is induced to treat the complication. The classification is designed to eliminate subjective interpretation of serious adverse events and tendency to down-rate complications, being based on data that is usually well documented and easy to verify. It is also well suited for retrospective analyses.

Concepts.definition: A classification of adverse events that grades complications according to the treatment that is induced to treat the complication. The classification is designed to eliminate subjective interpretation of serious adverse events and tendency to down-rate complications, being based on data that is usually well documented and easy to verify. It is also well suited for retrospective analyses.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the senses._Injury to nervous tissue._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Injury to nervous tissue.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes._A classification of adverse events that grades complications according to the treatment that is induced to treat the complication. The classification is designed to eliminate subjective interpretation of serious adverse events and tendency to down-rate complications, being based on data that is usually well documented and easy to verify. It is also well suited for retrospective analyses.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade I: Deviation from normal postoperative course without need for pharmacologic treatment or surgical, endoscopic and radiological intervention. Allowed therapies are: antiemetics, antipyretics, analgesics, diuretics, electrolytes and physical therapy.
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade I: Deviation from normal postoperative course without need for pharmacologic treatment or surgical, endoscopic and radiological intervention. Allowed therapies are: antiemetics, antipyretics, analgesics, diuretics, electrolytes and physical therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Grade I: Deviation from normal postoperative course without need for pharmacologic treatment or surgical, endoscopic and radiological intervention. Allowed therapies are: antiemetics, antipyretics, analgesics, diuretics, electrolytes and physical therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade I: Deviation from normal postoperative course without need for pharmacologic treatment or surgical, endoscopic and radiological intervention. Allowed therapies are: antiemetics, antipyretics, analgesics, diuretics, electrolytes and physical therapy.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade II: Requiring pharmacologic intervention other than those permitted per Grade 1 definition. Blood transfusions and TPN are also included
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Grade II: Requiring pharmacologic intervention other than those permitted per Grade 1 definition. Blood transfusions and TPN are also included

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade III: Requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention

PermissibleValues.value: Grade IIIa: Requiring surgical, endoscopic, or radiological intervention without the use of general anesthesia.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intervention Required Without Anesthesia Procedure Use
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage._Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone._Treatment with a pharmacological substance that produces a loss of feeling._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
Treatment with a pharmacological substance that produces a loss of feeling.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade IIIb: Requiring surgical, endoscopic, or radiological intervention under general anesthesia.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intervention Required With General Anesthesia Procedure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._Actions that render a patient unconscious for the purpose of performing a diagnostic or interventional procedure.

Concepts.definition: A patient condition when action or ministration whose purpose is to improve health or to alter the course of a disease is considered essential and mandatory in order to prevent permanent impairment or damage.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Actions that render a patient unconscious for the purpose of performing a diagnostic or interventional procedure.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade IVa: Life-threatening complication requiring ICU management - single organ dysfunction (includes dialysis)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event Requirement Intensive Care Unit Management Single Organ Failure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy._The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something._Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else._The failure of an essential system in the body.

Concepts.longName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
Concepts.definition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.
The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.
Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
The failure of an essential system in the body.

PermissibleValues.value: Grade IVb: Life-threatening complication requiring ICU management - multi-organ dysfunction

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event Requirement Intensive Care Unit Management Multiple Organ Failure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy._The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something._Complete impairment of two or more organs or organ systems.

Concepts.longName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
Concepts.definition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.
The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.
Complete impairment of two or more organs or organ systems.
